definitions: leader or head of a clan, tribe, or group, traditionally holding hereditary authority
examples: The chieftain called his warriors to gather for council
Highland chieftains ruled their clans for many generations

definitions: lightweight, transparent fabric made from silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers
examples: She wore an elegant chiffon gown to the gala
The designer draped layers of chiffon for a flowing effect

definitions: young human being between infancy and puberty
son or daughter of any age in relation to parents
examples: The child played happily in the sandbox all afternoon
Every child deserves access to quality education and healthcare
She is the youngest child of three siblings
Parents worry about their children regardless of age

definitions: process of conceiving, carrying, and giving birth to children
examples: Women of childbearing age should take folic acid supplements
Many cultures have traditional practices surrounding childbearing and motherhood

definitions: act or process of giving birth to a baby
examples: She attended prenatal classes to prepare for childbirth
Modern medicine has made childbirth much safer than before

definitions: supervision and care provided for children, especially by someone other than parents
examples: Finding affordable childcare remains a challenge for working parents
The company offers on-site childcare facilities for employees

definitions: period of being a child, typically from birth to puberty
examples: Her childhood memories of summer vacations remain vivid
Early childhood experiences shape adult personality and behavior

definitions: hot pepper pod from various capsicum plants used in cooking
examples: The recipe calls for fresh green chiles and tomatoes
Roasted chiles add smoky flavor to southwestern dishes

definitions: spicy stew containing meat, beans, tomatoes, and chili peppers
hot pepper from capsicum plants used as spice
examples: She won the annual chili cook-off with her recipe
This chili needs to simmer for at least two hours
Add dried chili flakes to taste for extra heat
Fresh chili peppers provide more flavor than powdered versions

definitions: unpleasant feeling of coldness in atmosphere or body
state of relaxation or calm, especially in informal contexts
examples: There was a chill in the autumn morning air
She felt a sudden chill run down her spine
Let's just chill and watch movies this weekend
The beach bar had a perfect chill vibe

definitions: industrial refrigeration unit or cooling system for buildings
horror or suspense story designed to frighten or thrill
examples: The office building's chiller system needs annual maintenance
Industrial chillers keep the factory equipment from overheating
Stephen King's latest chiller topped the bestseller list
The movie was marketed as a psychological chiller

definitions: hot pepper from capsicum plants used as spice, British spelling
examples: The curry was loaded with fresh chilli and ginger
These chilli plants produce extremely hot peppers each season

definitions: quality of being frightening, disturbing, or causing fear and anxiety
examples: The witness gave a chilling account of the accident
There was something chilling about his complete lack of emotion

definitions: musical ringing sound made by bells or similar instruments
device in clocks that strikes bells to mark time
examples: Wind chimes created a peaceful melody in the garden
The church chimes could be heard throughout the village
The grandfather clock's chime announces every quarter hour
The doorbell chime needs a new battery to work

definitions: fire-breathing monster from Greek mythology with parts from different animals
illusion or fabrication of the mind; unrealistic hope or dream
examples: The ancient vase depicted a chimera with lion, goat, and serpent parts
In mythology, the chimera terrorized the countryside until defeated
His plan for instant wealth was nothing but a chimera
The perfect society remains a chimera despite our efforts

definitions: vertical structure that channels smoke and gases from a fireplace or furnace
examples: Santa Claus traditionally enters homes through the chimney
The old chimney needed cleaning before winter heating season

definitions: informal shortened name for chimpanzee, an African great ape
examples: The chimp used tools to extract termites from the mound
Researchers studied chimp behavior in their natural habitat

definitions: intelligent African ape closely related to humans, sharing over 98% of DNA
examples: Chimpanzees demonstrate remarkable problem-solving abilities in the wild
The sanctuary cares for orphaned chimpanzees rescued from poachers

definitions: protruding part of the face below the mouth, formed by the lower jaw
examples: He stroked his chin thoughtfully while considering the proposal
The boxer took a direct hit to the chin

definitions: high-quality porcelain or ceramic dishes and ornamental ware
examples: The wedding china was passed down through three generations
She carefully washed the delicate china tea set

definitions: small South American rodent with soft, dense gray fur
valuable soft fur from chinchilla animals used in luxury clothing
examples: Chinchillas take dust baths to keep their fur clean
The pet chinchilla requires a special diet and environment
The vintage chinchilla coat sold for thousands at auction
Chinchilla fur is among the softest and most expensive

definitions: durable cotton twill fabric with a slight sheen
casual pants made from chino cloth, typically khaki colored
examples: The uniforms were made from sturdy chino fabric
Chino has been used for military uniforms since the 1800s
He wore chinos and a polo shirt to the office
These chinos go well with both casual and dressy tops

definitions: small piece broken or cut from something larger
microprocessor or integrated circuit used in electronics
thin slice of potato or corn fried until crispy
examples: A chip of paint fell from the old window frame
The sculptor carefully removed chips of marble with each strike
The new chip processes data twice as fast as before
Computer chips continue to become smaller and more powerful
She bought chips and salsa for the party
These potato chips are baked instead of fried

definitions: small striped North American rodent similar to a squirrel with cheek pouches
examples: The chipmunk stuffed its cheeks with acorns for winter
Chipmunks scurried across the forest floor gathering seeds

definitions: smoke-dried jalapeño pepper used in Mexican cuisine for smoky, spicy flavor
examples: The chipotle sauce added a smoky heat to the tacos
Canned chipotles in adobo sauce are a pantry staple

definitions: process or action of breaking off small pieces from a surface
examples: The chipping of the old paint revealed multiple layers underneath
Careful chipping away at the fossil took weeks of work

definitions: system of complementary medicine focusing on diagnosis and treatment of mechanical disorders of the spine
examples: Chiropractic care helped alleviate her chronic back pain
The clinic offers both chiropractic and physical therapy services

definitions: healthcare professional who treats musculoskeletal problems through manual adjustment of the spine
examples: The chiropractor adjusted her spine to relieve nerve pressure
Many athletes see a chiropractor for injury prevention

definitions: short, sharp sound made by small birds or insects
examples: Cricket chirps filled the warm summer evening air
The baby birds chirped constantly when their mother approached

definitions: hand tool with a sharp blade used for cutting or shaping wood, stone, or metal
examples: The sculptor used a chisel to carve details into marble
A sharp chisel makes clean cuts in hardwood

definitions: short official note, receipt, or voucher recording a transaction or debt
examples: She signed a chit for the supplies taken from storage
The waiter brought the chit for our meal expenses

definitions: medieval knightly system emphasizing bravery, courtesy, honor, and protection of the weak
examples: Tales of chivalry inspired young knights to noble deeds
Some argue that chivalry is outdated in modern society

definitions: greenish-yellow gas used for water purification and as a bleaching agent
examples: The pool water smelled strongly of chlorine after treatment
Chlorine tablets help keep drinking water safe from bacteria

definitions: green pigment in plants that absorbs light energy for photosynthesis
examples: Chlorophyll gives leaves their characteristic green color
Plants produce less chlorophyll as autumn approaches

definitions: informal shortened term for chocolate or a chocolate candy
examples: Would you like a choc from the selection box?
The kids begged for chocs at the candy store

definitions: wedge or block placed against a wheel or rounded object to prevent movement
examples: Place chocks behind the airplane wheels before maintenance
The trailer chocks kept it from rolling down the slope

definitions: food made from roasted cacao beans, typically sweetened and used in confections
dark brown color resembling chocolate
examples: Dark chocolate contains more antioxidants than milk chocolate
She melted chocolate chips to make brownies
The leather couch came in chocolate and tan options
Her chocolate brown eyes matched her hair perfectly

definitions: act of selecting between two or more possibilities
of very good quality, especially regarding food
examples: The choice between career and family proved difficult
Students have a choice of three elective courses
The butcher displayed choice cuts of prime beef
Only choice ingredients go into these gourmet meals

definitions: organized group of singers performing together, especially in religious services
examples: The church choir performed beautifully at the Christmas service
She joined the school choir to improve her singing

definitions: person who trains and conducts a choir in rehearsals and performances
examples: The choirmaster selected challenging pieces for the spring concert
An experienced choirmaster can bring out the best in amateur singers

definitions: obstruction of the airway preventing normal breathing
valve in an engine that restricts airflow to enrich fuel mixture
examples: The Heimlich maneuver can save someone from a dangerous choke
A piece of food caused a choke that required immediate help
Pull the choke out when starting a cold engine
The motorcycle's choke helps it start on cold mornings

definitions: condition of having the airway blocked, preventing normal breathing
examples: Choking hazards should be kept away from small children
The restaurant staff was trained in choking first aid

definitions: acute bacterial infection of the intestine causing severe diarrhea and dehydration
examples: Cholera outbreaks often follow natural disasters affecting water supplies
John Snow traced a cholera epidemic to contaminated water

definitions: waxy substance in blood that can build up in arteries, affecting heart health
examples: High cholesterol increases the risk of heart disease
Regular exercise helps maintain healthy cholesterol levels

definitions: thick slice of meat including a rib, especially pork or lamb
quick downward cutting stroke or the act of cutting
examples: The lamb chops were grilled to perfection with rosemary
Pork chops make an easy weeknight dinner option
The karate chop broke the wooden board cleanly
One chop of the axe split the log

definitions: informal term for helicopter
tool or device used for chopping, such as a meat cleaver
examples: The medical chopper arrived within minutes of the call
News choppers circled overhead covering the event
Use a heavy chopper to cut through the chicken bones
The food chopper makes quick work of vegetables

definitions: relating to or sung by a choir or chorus
examples: The choral arrangement required eight-part harmony
Beethoven's choral symphony remains a masterpiece

definitions: traditional hymn tune, especially in German Protestant tradition
choir or choral society
examples: Bach harmonized many Lutheran chorales in his works
The chorale's melody dates back to the 16th century
The community chorale welcomes singers of all skill levels
The chorale performed at the town's holiday celebration

definitions: group of three or more musical notes played simultaneously
straight line connecting two points on a curve
examples: The opening chord of the song immediately grabbed attention
She struggled to play the F major chord on guitar
Calculate the length of the chord across the circle
The chord divides the circle into two segments

definitions: routine task or job, especially household work that must be done regularly
examples: Children often receive allowance for completing weekly chores
Doing laundry is her least favorite household chore
